summary:
Collect multiple classes of metrics. This 'meta-metrics' tool runs one or more of the metrics collection modules at the same time to cut down on the time spent reading in data from input files. For each PROGRAM, the tool produces outputs. The valid values for PROGRAM and the output that would be generated by it are listed in the documentation of the PROGRAM argument.

Currently all programs are run with default options and fixed output extensions, but this may become more flexible in future. Specifying a reference sequence file is required.

Note: Metrics labeled as percentages (PCT_*) are actually expressed as fractions!

Usage example (all modules on by default):

java -jar picard.jar CollectMultipleMetrics \
      I=input.bam \
      O=multiple_metrics \
      R=reference_sequence.fasta

Usage example (two modules only):

java -jar picard.jar CollectMultipleMetrics \
I=input.bam \
O=multiple_metrics \
R=reference_sequence.fasta \
PROGRAM=null \
PROGRAM=QualityScoreDistribution \
PROGRAM=MeanQualityByCycle

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: If true (default), then the sort order in the header file will be ignored.
arguments.name: --ASSUME_SORTED

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create an index when writing VCF or coordinate sorted BAM output.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: VCF format dbSNP file, used to exclude regions around known polymorphisms from analysis by some PROGRAMs; PROGRAMs whose CLP doesn't allow for this argument will quietly ignore it.
arguments.name: --DB_SNP

arguments.summary:
extra arguments to the various tools can be specified using the following format:<PROGRAM>::<ARGUMENT_AND_VALUE> where <PROGRAM> is one of the programs specified in PROGRAM, and <ARGUMENT_AND_VALUE> are the argument and value that you'd like to specify as you would on the command line. For example, to change the HISTOGRAM_WIDTH in CollectInsertSizeMetrics to 200, use:
 "EXTRA_ARGUMENT=CollectInsertSizeMetrics::HISTOGRAM_WIDTH=200"
 or, in the new parser:--EXTRA_ARGUMENT "CollectInsertSizeMetrics::--HISTOGRAM_WIDTH 200"
 (Quotes are required to avoid the shell from separating this into two arguments.) Note that the following arguments cannot be modified on a per-program level: INPUT, REFERENCE_SEQUENCE, ASSUME_SORTED, and STOP_AFTER. Providing them in an EXTRA_ARGUMENT will _not_ result in an error, but they will be silently ignored.
arguments.name: --EXTRA_ARGUMENT

arguments.summary: Append the given file extension to all metric file names (ex. OUTPUT.insert_size_metrics.EXT). None if null
arguments.name: --FILE_EXTENSION

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: If a read maps to a sequence specified with this option, all the bases in the read are counted as ignored bases.
arguments.name: --IGNORE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: Include unpaired reads in CollectSequencingArtifactMetrics. If set to true then all paired reads will be included as well - MINIMUM_INSERT_SIZE and MAXIMUM_INSERT_SIZE will be ignored in CollectSequencingArtifactMetrics.
arguments.name: --INCLUDE_UNPAIRED

arguments.summary: Input SAM or BAM file.
arguments.name: --INPUT

arguments.summary: An optional list of intervals to restrict analysis to. Only pertains to some of the PROGRAMs. Programs whose stand-alone CLP does not have an INTERVALS argument will silently ignore this argument.
arguments.name: --INTERVALS

arguments.summary: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: The level(s) at which to accumulate metrics.
arguments.name: --METRIC_ACCUMULATION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Base name of output files.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: Set of metrics programs to apply during the pass through the SAM file.
arguments.name: --PROGRAM

options.summary: Produces a summary of alignment metrics from a SAM or BAM file. Creates output with ".alignment_summary_metrics, .read_length_histogram.pdf" appended to OUTPUT.
options.name: CollectAlignmentSummaryMetrics

options.summary: Collect metrics about the insert size distribution of a paired-end library. Creates output with ".insert_size_metrics, .insert_size_histogram.pdf" appended to OUTPUT.
options.name: CollectInsertSizeMetrics

options.summary: Chart the distribution of quality scores.  Creates output with ".quality_distribution_metrics, .quality_distribution.pdf" appended to OUTPUT.
options.name: QualityScoreDistribution

options.summary: Collect mean quality by cycle.Creates output with ".quality_by_cycle_metrics, .quality_by_cycle.pdf" appended to OUTPUT.
options.name: MeanQualityByCycle

options.summary: Chart the nucleotide distribution per cycle in a SAM or BAM fileCreates output with ".base_distribution_by_cycle_metrics, .base_distribution_by_cycle.pdf" appended to OUTPUT.
options.name: CollectBaseDistributionByCycle

options.summary: Collect metrics regarding GC bias. Creates output with ".gc_bias.detail_metrics, .gc_bias.summary_metrics, .gc_bias.pdf" appended to OUTPUT.
options.name: CollectGcBiasMetrics

options.summary: Produces RNA alignment metrics for a SAM or BAM file.  Creates output with ".rna_metrics, .rna_coverage.pdf" appended to OUTPUT.
options.name: RnaSeqMetrics

options.summary: Collect metrics to quantify single-base sequencing artifacts.  Creates output with ".bait_bias_detail_metrics, .bait_bias_summary_metrics, .pre_adapter_detail_metrics, .pre_adapter_summary_metrics, .error_summary_metrics" appended to OUTPUT.
options.name: CollectSequencingArtifactMetrics

options.summary: Collect metrics about reads that pass quality thresholds and Illumina-specific filters.  Creates output with ".quality_yield_metrics" appended to OUTPUT.
options.name: CollectQualityYieldMetrics

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Gene annotations in refFlat form.  Format described here: http://genome.ucsc.edu/goldenPath/gbdDescriptionsOld.html#RefFlat
arguments.name: --REF_FLAT

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: Stop after processing N reads, mainly for debugging.
arguments.name: --STOP_AFTER

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

description:
Class that is designed to instantiate and execute multiple metrics programs that extend
 SinglePassSamProgram while making only a single pass through the SAM file and supplying
 each program with the records as it goes.
@author Tim Fennell
name: CollectMultipleMetrics
